AssociateUserToPermissionGroup.name: AssociateUserToPermissionGroup
AssociateUserToPermissionGroup.documentation: Adds a user to a permission group to grant permissions for actions a user can perform in FinSpace.

CreateChangeset.name: CreateChangeset
CreateChangeset.documentation: Creates a new Changeset in a FinSpace Dataset.

CreatePermissionGroup.name: CreatePermissionGroup
CreatePermissionGroup.documentation: Creates a group of permissions for various actions that a user can perform in FinSpace.

DeletePermissionGroup.name: DeletePermissionGroup
DeletePermissionGroup.documentation: Deletes a permission group. This action is irreversible.

DisableUser.name: DisableUser
DisableUser.documentation: Denies access to the FinSpace web application and API for the specified user.

DisassociateUserFromPermissionGroup.name: DisassociateUserFromPermissionGroup
DisassociateUserFromPermissionGroup.documentation: Removes a user from a permission group.

EnableUser.name: EnableUser
EnableUser.documentation: Allows the specified user to access the FinSpace web application and API.

GetExternalDataViewAccessDetails.name: GetExternalDataViewAccessDetails
GetExternalDataViewAccessDetails.documentation:
Returns the credentials to access the external Dataview from an S3 location. To call this API:

  • You must retrieve the programmatic credentials.

  • You must be a member of a FinSpace user group, where the dataset that you want to access has Read Dataset Data permissions.

GetPermissionGroup.name: GetPermissionGroup
GetPermissionGroup.documentation: Retrieves the details of a specific permission group.

GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials.name: GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials
GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials.documentation: Request programmatic credentials to use with FinSpace SDK. For more information, see Step 2. Access credentials programmatically using IAM access key id and secret access key.

GetWorkingLocation.name: GetWorkingLocation
GetWorkingLocation.documentation: A temporary Amazon S3 location, where you can copy your files from a source location to stage or use as a scratch space in FinSpace notebook.

ListChangesets.name: ListChangesets
ListChangesets.documentation: Lists the FinSpace Changesets for a Dataset.

ListDataViews.name: ListDataViews
ListDataViews.documentation: Lists all available Dataviews for a Dataset.

ListDatasets.name: ListDatasets
ListDatasets.documentation: Lists all of the active Datasets that a user has access to.

ListPermissionGroups.name: ListPermissionGroups
ListPermissionGroups.documentation: Lists all available permission groups in FinSpace.

ListPermissionGroupsByUser.name: ListPermissionGroupsByUser
ListPermissionGroupsByUser.documentation: Lists all the permission groups that are associated with a specific user.

ListUsersByPermissionGroup.name: ListUsersByPermissionGroup
ListUsersByPermissionGroup.documentation: Lists details of all the users in a specific permission group.

ResetUserPassword.name: ResetUserPassword
ResetUserPassword.documentation: Resets the password for a specified user ID and generates a temporary one. Only a superuser can reset password for other users. Resetting the password immediately invalidates the previous password associated with the user.

UpdatePermissionGroup.name: UpdatePermissionGroup
UpdatePermissionGroup.documentation: Modifies the details of a permission group. You cannot modify a permissionGroupID.

UpdateUser.name: UpdateUser
UpdateUser.documentation: Modifies the details of the specified user. You cannot update the userId for a user.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

permissionGroupId.documentation: The unique identifier for the permission group.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

statusCode.documentation: The returned status code of the response.

accessKeyId.documentation: The unique identifier for the security credentials.

secretAccessKey.documentation: The secret access key that can be used to sign requests.

sessionToken.documentation: The token that users must pass to use the credentials.

expiration.documentation: The Epoch time when the current credentials expire.

AwsCredentials.documentation: The credentials required to access the external Dataview from the S3 location.

ChangeType.documentation: Indicates how the given change will be applied to the dataset.

errorCategory.documentation:
The category of the error.

  • VALIDATION – The inputs to this request are invalid.

  • SERVICE_QUOTA_EXCEEDED – Service quotas have been exceeded. Please contact AWS support to increase quotas.

  • ACCESS_DENIED – Missing required permission to perform this request.

  • RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND – One or more inputs to this request were not found.

  • THROTTLING – The system temporarily lacks sufficient resources to process the request.

  • INTERNAL_SERVICE_EXCEPTION – An internal service error has occurred.

  • CANCELLED – Cancelled.

  • USER_RECOVERABLE – A user recoverable error has occurred.

ChangesetId.documentation: ID used to identify a Changeset

datasetId.documentation: The unique identifier for the FinSpace Dataset in which the Changeset is created.

changeType.documentation:
Type that indicates how a Changeset is applied to a Dataset.

  • REPLACE – Changeset is considered as a replacement to all prior loaded Changesets.

  • APPEND – Changeset is considered as an addition to the end of all prior loaded Changesets.

  • MODIFY – Changeset is considered as a replacement to a specific prior ingested Changeset.

sourceParams.documentation: Options that define the location of the data being ingested.

formatParams.documentation: Options that define the structure of the source file(s).

createTime.documentation: The timestamp at which the Changeset was created in FinSpace. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

status.documentation:
Status of the Changeset ingestion.

  • PENDING – Changeset is pending creation.

  • FAILED – Changeset creation has failed.

  • SUCCESS – Changeset creation has succeeded.

  • RUNNING – Changeset creation is running.

  • STOP_REQUESTED – User requested Changeset creation to stop.

activeUntilTimestamp.documentation: Time until which the Changeset is active. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

activeFromTimestamp.documentation: Beginning time from which the Changeset is active. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

updatesChangesetId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Changeset that is updated.

updatedByChangesetId.documentation: The unique identifier of the updated Changeset.

ChangesetSummary.documentation: A Changeset is unit of data in a Dataset.

dataType.documentation:
Data type of a column.

  • STRING – A String data type.

    CHAR – A char data type.

    INTEGER – An integer data type.

    TINYINT – A tinyint data type.

    SMALLINT – A smallint data type.

    BIGINT – A bigint data type.

    FLOAT – A float data type.

    DOUBLE – A double data type.

    DATE – A date data type.

    DATETIME – A datetime data type.

    BOOLEAN – A boolean data type.

    BINARY – A binary data type.

ColumnDefinition.documentation: The definition of a column in a tabular Dataset.

ConflictException.documentation: The request conflicts with an existing resource.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

datasetId.documentation: The unique identifier for the FinSpace Dataset where the Changeset will be created.

changeType.documentation:
The option to indicate how a Changeset will be applied to a Dataset.

  • REPLACE – Changeset will be considered as a replacement to all prior loaded Changesets.

  • APPEND – Changeset will be considered as an addition to the end of all prior loaded Changesets.

  • MODIFY – Changeset is considered as a replacement to a specific prior ingested Changeset.

sourceParams.documentation:
Options that define the location of the data being ingested (s3SourcePath) and the source of the changeset (sourceType).

Both s3SourcePath and sourceType are required attributes.

Here is an example of how you could specify the sourceParams:

"sourceParams": { "s3SourcePath": "s3://finspace-landing-us-east-2-bk7gcfvitndqa6ebnvys4d/scratch/wr5hh8pwkpqqkxa4sxrmcw/ingestion/equity.csv", "sourceType": "S3" }

The S3 path that you specify must allow the FinSpace role access. To do that, you first need to configure the IAM policy on S3 bucket. For more information, see Loading data from an Amazon S3 Bucket using the FinSpace API section.

formatParams.documentation:
Options that define the structure of the source file(s) including the format type (formatType), header row (withHeader), data separation character (separator) and the type of compression (compression).

formatType is a required attribute and can have the following values:

  • PARQUET – Parquet source file format.

  • CSV – CSV source file format.

  • JSON – JSON source file format.

  • XML – XML source file format.

Here is an example of how you could specify the formatParams:

"formatParams": { "formatType": "CSV", "withHeader": "true", "separator": ",", "compression":"None" }

Note that if you only provide formatType as CSV, the rest of the attributes will automatically default to CSV values as following:

{ "withHeader": "true", "separator": "," }

For more information about supported file formats, see Supported Data Types and File Formats in the FinSpace User Guide.

CreateChangesetRequest.documentation: The request for a CreateChangeset operation.

datasetId.documentation: The unique identifier for the FinSpace Dataset where the Changeset is created.

changesetId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Changeset that is created.

CreateChangesetResponse.documentation: The response from a CreateChangeset operation.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

datasetId.documentation: The unique Dataset identifier that is used to create a Dataview.

autoUpdate.documentation: Flag to indicate Dataview should be updated automatically.

sortColumns.documentation: Columns to be used for sorting the data.

partitionColumns.documentation: Ordered set of column names used to partition data.

asOfTimestamp.documentation: Beginning time to use for the Dataview. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

destinationTypeParams.documentation: Options that define the destination type for the Dataview.

CreateDataViewRequest.documentation: Request for creating a data view.

datasetId.documentation: The unique identifier of the Dataset used for the Dataview.

dataViewId.documentation: The unique identifier for the created Dataview.

CreateDataViewResponse.documentation: Response for creating a data view.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

kind.documentation:
The format in which Dataset data is structured.

  • TABULAR – Data is structured in a tabular format.

  • NON_TABULAR – Data is structured in a non-tabular format.

alias.documentation: The unique resource identifier for a Dataset.

schemaDefinition.documentation: Definition for a schema on a tabular Dataset.

CreateDatasetRequest.documentation: The request for a CreateDataset operation

datasetId.documentation: The unique identifier for the created Dataset.

CreateDatasetResponse.documentation: The response from a CreateDataset operation

description.documentation: A brief description for the permission group.

applicationPermissions.documentation:
The option to indicate FinSpace application permissions that are granted to a specific group.

When assigning application permissions, be aware that the permission ManageUsersAndGroups allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in their FinSpace environment's application. It should only be granted to trusted users.

  • CreateDataset – Group members can create new datasets.

  • ManageClusters – Group members can manage Apache Spark clusters from FinSpace notebooks.

  • ManageUsersAndGroups – Group members can manage users and permission groups. This is a privileged permission that allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in the application. It should only be granted to trusted users.

  • ManageAttributeSets – Group members can manage attribute sets.

  • ViewAuditData – Group members can view audit data.

  • AccessNotebooks – Group members will have access to FinSpace notebooks.

  • GetTemporaryCredentials – Group members can get temporary API credentials.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

permissionGroupId.documentation: The unique identifier for the permission group.

emailAddress.documentation: The email address of the user that you want to register. The email address serves as a uniquer identifier for each user and cannot be changed after it's created.

type.documentation:
The option to indicate the type of user. Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:

  • SUPER_USER – A user with permission to all the functionality and data in FinSpace.

  • APP_USER – A user with specific permissions in FinSpace. The users are assigned permissions by adding them to a permission group.

firstName.documentation: The first name of the user that you want to register.

lastName.documentation: The last name of the user that you want to register.

apiAccess.documentation:
The option to indicate whether the user can use the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain credentials that can then be used to access other FinSpace Data API operations.

  • ENABLED – The user has permissions to use the APIs.

  • DISABLED – The user does not have permissions to use any APIs.

apiAccessPrincipalArn.documentation: The ARN identifier of an AWS user or role that is allowed to call the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain a credentials token for a specific FinSpace user. This must be an IAM role within your FinSpace account.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

destinationType.documentation:
Destination type for a Dataview.

  • GLUE_TABLE – Glue table destination type.

  • S3 – S3 destination type.

s3DestinationExportFileFormat.documentation:
Dataview export file format.

  • PARQUET – Parquet export file format.

  • DELIMITED_TEXT – Delimited text export file format.

s3DestinationExportFileFormatOptions.documentation:
Format Options for S3 Destination type.

Here is an example of how you could specify the s3DestinationExportFileFormatOptions

{ "header": "true", "delimiter": ",", "compression": "gzip" }

DataViewDestinationTypeParams.documentation: Structure for the Dataview destination type parameters.

errorCategory.documentation:
The category of the error.

  • VALIDATION – The inputs to this request are invalid.

  • SERVICE_QUOTA_EXCEEDED – Service quotas have been exceeded. Please contact AWS support to increase quotas.

  • ACCESS_DENIED – Missing required permission to perform this request.

  • RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND – One or more inputs to this request were not found.

  • THROTTLING – The system temporarily lacks sufficient resources to process the request.

  • INTERNAL_SERVICE_EXCEPTION – An internal service error has occurred.

  • CANCELLED – Cancelled.

  • USER_RECOVERABLE – A user recoverable error has occurred.

datasetId.documentation: Th unique identifier for the Dataview Dataset.

asOfTimestamp.documentation: Time range to use for the Dataview. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

partitionColumns.documentation: Ordered set of column names used to partition data.

sortColumns.documentation: Columns to be used for sorting the data.

status.documentation:
The status of a Dataview creation.

  • RUNNING – Dataview creation is running.

  • STARTING – Dataview creation is starting.

  • FAILED – Dataview creation has failed.

  • CANCELLED – Dataview creation has been cancelled.

  • TIMEOUT – Dataview creation has timed out.

  • SUCCESS – Dataview creation has succeeded.

  • PENDING – Dataview creation is pending.

  • FAILED_CLEANUP_FAILED – Dataview creation failed and resource cleanup failed.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: The last time that a Dataview was modified. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.

The unique identifier for the user that is retrieved.

status.documentation:
The current status of the user.

  • CREATING – The creation is in progress.

  • ENABLED – The user is created and is currently active.

  • DISABLED – The user is currently inactive.

emailAddress.documentation: The email address that is associated with the user.

type.documentation:
Indicates the type of user.

  • SUPER_USER – A user with permission to all the functionality and data in FinSpace.

  • APP_USER – A user with specific permissions in FinSpace. The users are assigned permissions by adding them to a permission group.

apiAccess.documentation:
Indicates whether the user can use the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain credentials that can then be used to access other FinSpace Data API operations.

  • ENABLED – The user has permissions to use the APIs.

  • DISABLED – The user does not have permissions to use any APIs.

apiAccessPrincipalArn.documentation: The ARN identifier of an AWS user or role that is allowed to call the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain a credentials token for a specific FinSpace user. This must be an IAM role within your FinSpace account.

createTime.documentation: The timestamp at which the user was created in FinSpace. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

lastEnabledTime.documentation: Describes the last time the user was activated. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

lastDisabledTime.documentation: Describes the last time the user was deactivated. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: Describes the last time the user details were updated. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

lastLoginTime.documentation: Describes the last time that the user logged into their account. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

locationType.documentation:
Specify the type of the working location.

  • SAGEMAKER – Use the Amazon S3 location as a temporary location to store data content when working with FinSpace Notebooks that run on SageMaker studio.

  • INGESTION – Use the Amazon S3 location as a staging location to copy your data content and then use the location with the Changeset creation operation.

s3Uri.documentation: Returns the Amazon S3 URI for the working location.

s3Path.documentation: Returns the Amazon S3 Path for the working location.

s3Bucket.documentation: Returns the Amazon S3 bucket name for the working location.

IngestionStatus.documentation: Status of the ingestion process returned from scheduler service.

InternalServerException.documentation: The request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception or failure.

nextToken.documentation: A token that indicates where a results page should begin.

A token that indicates where a results page should begin.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results per page.

nextToken.documentation: A token that indicates where a results page should begin.

permissionGroupId.documentation: The unique identifier for the permission group.

description.documentation: A brief description for the permission group.

applicationPermissions.documentation:
Indicates the permissions that are granted to a specific group for accessing the FinSpace application.

When assigning application permissions, be aware that the permission ManageUsersAndGroups allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in their FinSpace environment's application. It should only be granted to trusted users.

  • CreateDataset – Group members can create new datasets.

  • ManageClusters – Group members can manage Apache Spark clusters from FinSpace notebooks.

  • ManageUsersAndGroups – Group members can manage users and permission groups. This is a privileged permission that allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in the application. It should only be granted to trusted users.

  • ManageAttributeSets – Group members can manage attribute sets.

  • ViewAuditData – Group members can view audit data.

  • AccessNotebooks – Group members will have access to FinSpace notebooks.

  • GetTemporaryCredentials – Group members can get temporary API credentials.

createTime.documentation: The timestamp at which the group was created in FinSpace. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: Describes the last time the permission group was updated. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

membershipStatus.documentation:
Indicates the status of the user within a permission group.

  • ADDITION_IN_PROGRESS – The user is currently being added to the permission group.

  • ADDITION_SUCCESS – The user is successfully added to the permission group.

  • REMOVAL_IN_PROGRESS – The user is currently being removed from the permission group.

permissionGroupId.documentation: The unique identifier for the permission group.

membershipStatus.documentation:
Indicates the status of the user within a permission group.

  • ADDITION_IN_PROGRESS – The user is currently being added to the permission group.

  • ADDITION_SUCCESS – The user is successfully added to the permission group.

  • REMOVAL_IN_PROGRESS – The user is currently being removed from the permission group.

PermissionGroupByUser.documentation: The structure of a permission group associated with a user.

PermissionGroupParams.documentation:
Permission group parameters for Dataset permissions.

Here is an example of how you could specify the PermissionGroupParams:

{ "permissionGroupId": "0r6fCRtSTUk4XPfXQe3M0g", "datasetPermissions": [ {"permission": "ViewDatasetDetails"}, {"permission": "AddDatasetData"}, {"permission": "EditDatasetMetadata"}, {"permission": "DeleteDataset"} ] }

userId.documentation: The unique identifier of the user that a temporary password is requested for.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

userId.documentation: The unique identifier of the user that a new password is generated for.

temporaryPassword.documentation: A randomly generated temporary password for the requested user. This password expires in 7 days.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: One or more resources can't be found.

ResourcePermission.documentation:
Resource permission for a dataset. When you create a dataset, all the other members of the same user group inherit access to the dataset. You can only create a dataset if your user group has application permission for Create Datasets.

The following is a list of valid dataset permissions that you can apply:

  • ViewDatasetDetails

  • ReadDatasetDetails

  • AddDatasetData

  • CreateDataView

  • EditDatasetMetadata

  • DeleteDataset

For more information on the dataset permissions, see Supported Dataset Permissions in the FinSpace User Guide.

bucket.documentation: The name of the S3 bucket.

key.documentation: The path of the folder, within the S3 bucket that contains the Dataset.

S3Location.documentation: The location of an external Dataview in an S3 bucket.

primaryKeyColumns.documentation: List of column names used for primary key.

SchemaDefinition.documentation: Definition for a schema on a tabular Dataset.

tabularSchemaConfig.documentation: The configuration for a schema on a tabular Dataset.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The request was denied due to request throttling.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

datasetId.documentation: The unique identifier for the FinSpace Dataset in which the Changeset is created.

changesetId.documentation: The unique identifier for the Changeset to update.

sourceParams.documentation:
Options that define the location of the data being ingested (s3SourcePath) and the source of the changeset (sourceType).

Both s3SourcePath and sourceType are required attributes.

Here is an example of how you could specify the sourceParams:

"sourceParams": { "s3SourcePath": "s3://finspace-landing-us-east-2-bk7gcfvitndqa6ebnvys4d/scratch/wr5hh8pwkpqqkxa4sxrmcw/ingestion/equity.csv", "sourceType": "S3" }

The S3 path that you specify must allow the FinSpace role access. To do that, you first need to configure the IAM policy on S3 bucket. For more information, see Loading data from an Amazon S3 Bucket using the FinSpace APIsection.

formatParams.documentation:
Options that define the structure of the source file(s) including the format type (formatType), header row (withHeader), data separation character (separator) and the type of compression (compression).

formatType is a required attribute and can have the following values:

  • PARQUET – Parquet source file format.

  • CSV – CSV source file format.

  • JSON – JSON source file format.

  • XML – XML source file format.

Here is an example of how you could specify the formatParams:

"formatParams": { "formatType": "CSV", "withHeader": "true", "separator": ",", "compression":"None" }

Note that if you only provide formatType as CSV, the rest of the attributes will automatically default to CSV values as following:

{ "withHeader": "true", "separator": "," }

For more information about supported file formats, see Supported Data Types and File Formats in the FinSpace User Guide.

UpdateChangesetRequest.documentation: Request to update an existing changeset.

changesetId.documentation: The unique identifier for the Changeset to update.

datasetId.documentation: The unique identifier for the FinSpace Dataset in which the Changeset is created.

UpdateChangesetResponse.documentation: The response from a update changeset operation.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

datasetId.documentation: The unique identifier for the Dataset to update.

kind.documentation:
The format in which the Dataset data is structured.

  • TABULAR – Data is structured in a tabular format.

  • NON_TABULAR – Data is structured in a non-tabular format.

alias.documentation: The unique resource identifier for a Dataset.

schemaDefinition.documentation: Definition for a schema on a tabular Dataset.

UpdateDatasetRequest.documentation: The request for an UpdateDataset operation

datasetId.documentation: The unique identifier for updated Dataset.

UpdateDatasetResponse.documentation: The response from an UpdateDataset operation

permissionGroupId.documentation: The unique identifier for the permission group to update.

description.documentation: A brief description for the permission group.

applicationPermissions.documentation:
The permissions that are granted to a specific group for accessing the FinSpace application.

When assigning application permissions, be aware that the permission ManageUsersAndGroups allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in their FinSpace environment's application. It should only be granted to trusted users.

  • CreateDataset – Group members can create new datasets.

  • ManageClusters – Group members can manage Apache Spark clusters from FinSpace notebooks.

  • ManageUsersAndGroups – Group members can manage users and permission groups. This is a privileged permission that allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in the application. It should only be granted to trusted users.

  • ManageAttributeSets – Group members can manage attribute sets.

  • ViewAuditData – Group members can view audit data.

  • AccessNotebooks – Group members will have access to FinSpace notebooks.

  • GetTemporaryCredentials – Group members can get temporary API credentials.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

permissionGroupId.documentation: The unique identifier for the updated permission group.

userId.documentation: The unique identifier for the user that you want to update.

type.documentation:
The option to indicate the type of user.

  • SUPER_USER– A user with permission to all the functionality and data in FinSpace.

  • APP_USER – A user with specific permissions in FinSpace. The users are assigned permissions by adding them to a permission group.

apiAccess.documentation:
The option to indicate whether the user can use the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain credentials that can then be used to access other FinSpace Data API operations.

  • ENABLED – The user has permissions to use the APIs.

  • DISABLED – The user does not have permissions to use any APIs.

apiAccessPrincipalArn.documentation: The ARN identifier of an AWS user or role that is allowed to call the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain a credentials token for a specific FinSpace user. This must be an IAM role within your FinSpace account.

clientToken.documentation: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

userId.documentation: The unique identifier of the updated user.

status.documentation:
The current status of the user.

  • CREATING – The user creation is in progress.

  • ENABLED – The user is created and is currently active.

  • DISABLED – The user is currently inactive.

lastName.documentation: The last name of the user.

emailAddress.documentation: The email address of the user. The email address serves as a uniquer identifier for each user and cannot be changed after it's created.

type.documentation:
Indicates the type of user.

  • SUPER_USER – A user with permission to all the functionality and data in FinSpace.

  • APP_USER – A user with specific permissions in FinSpace. The users are assigned permissions by adding them to a permission group.

apiAccess.documentation:
Indicates whether the user can use the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain credentials that can then be used to access other FinSpace Data API operations.

  • ENABLED – The user has permissions to use the APIs.

  • DISABLED – The user does not have permissions to use any APIs.

apiAccessPrincipalArn.documentation: The ARN identifier of an AWS user or role that is allowed to call the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain a credentials token for a specific FinSpace user. This must be an IAM role within your FinSpace account.

createTime.documentation: The timestamp at which the user was created in FinSpace. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

lastEnabledTime.documentation: Describes the last time the user was activated. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

lastDisabledTime.documentation: Describes the last time the user was deactivated. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: Describes the last time the user was updated. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

lastLoginTime.documentation: Describes the last time that the user logged into their account. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds.

status.documentation:
The current status of the user.

  • CREATING – The user creation is in progress.

  • ENABLED – The user is created and is currently active.

  • DISABLED – The user is currently inactive.

emailAddress.documentation: The email address of the user. The email address serves as a unique identifier for each user and cannot be changed after it's created.

type.documentation:
Indicates the type of user.

  • SUPER_USER – A user with permission to all the functionality and data in FinSpace.

  • APP_USER – A user with specific permissions in FinSpace. The users are assigned permissions by adding them to a permission group.

apiAccess.documentation:
Indicates whether the user can access FinSpace API operations.

  • ENABLED – The user has permissions to use the API operations.

  • DISABLED – The user does not have permissions to use any API operations.

apiAccessPrincipalArn.documentation: The IAM ARN identifier that is attached to FinSpace API calls.

membershipStatus.documentation:
Indicates the status of the user within a permission group.

  • ADDITION_IN_PROGRESS – The user is currently being added to the permission group.

  • ADDITION_SUCCESS – The user is successfully added to the permission group.

  • REMOVAL_IN_PROGRESS – The user is currently being removed from the permission group.

UserByPermissionGroup.documentation: The structure of a user associated with a permission group.

ValidationException.documentation: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.

documentation: The FinSpace APIs let you take actions inside the FinSpace.
